intro: Cryptantha debilis var. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, hairy leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
